verses.text: Sing, O barren, thou \add that\add* didst not bear; Break forth \add into\add* singing, and cry aloud, thou \add that\add* didst not travail with child: For more \add are\add* the children of the desolate than the children of the married wife, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.
Enlarge the place of thy tent, And let them stretch forth the curtains of thine habitations: Spare not, lengthen thy cords, and strengthen thy stakes;
For thou shalt break forth \add on\add* the right hand and \add on\add* the left; And thy seed shall inherit the Gentiles, And make the desolate cities to be inhabited.

Fear not; for thou shalt not be ashamed: Neither be thou confounded; for thou shalt not be put to shame: For thou shalt forget the shame of thy youth, And shalt not remember the reproach of thy widowhood any more.
For thy Maker \add is\add* thine husband; The \sc Lord\sc* of hosts \add is\add* his name; And thy redeemer the Holy One of Israel; The God of the whole earth shall he be called.
For the \sc Lord\sc* hath called thee as a woman forsaken and grieved in spirit, And a wife of youth, when thou wast refused, saith thy God.
For a small moment have I forsaken thee; But with great mercies will I gather thee.
In a little wrath I hid my face from thee for a moment; But with everlasting kindness will I have mercy on thee, Saith the \sc Lord\sc* thy redeemer.

For this \add is as\add* the waters of Noah unto me: For \add as\add* I have sworn that the waters of Noah should no more go over the earth; So have I sworn that \add I\add* would not be wroth with thee, nor rebuke thee.

For the mountains shall depart, And the hills be removed; But my kindness shall not depart from thee, Neither shall the covenant of my peace be removed, Saith the \sc Lord\sc* that hath mercy on thee.
O thou afflicted, tossed with tempest, \add and\add* not comforted, Behold, I will lay thy stones with fair colours, And lay thy foundations with sapphires.
And I will make thy windows \add of\add* agates, And thy gates of carbuncles, And all thy borders of pleasant stones.
And all thy children \add shall be\add* taught of the \sc Lord\sc*; And great \add shall be\add* the peace of thy children.
In righteousness shalt thou be established: Thou shalt be far from oppression; for thou shalt not fear: And from terror; for it shall not come near thee.
Behold, they shall surely gather together, \add but\add* not by me: Whosoever shall gather together against thee shall fall for thy sake.
Behold, I have created the smith That bloweth the coals in the fire, And that bringeth forth an instrument for his work; And I have created the waster to destroy.

No weapon \add that\add* is formed against thee shall prosper; And every tongue \add that\add* shall rise against thee in judgment thou shalt condemn. This \add is\add* the heritage of the servants of the \sc Lord\sc*, And their righteousness \add is\add* of me, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.
